We took pumpkin ( Cucurbita maxima) as our study system. It is a monoecious plant with separate staminate (male) and pistillate (female) flowers. Both flowers are borne on different nodes with a disproportionately high number of staminate flowers per field
37 . The staminate and pistillate flowers are large, showy yellow with abundant floral nectar—the pistillate flowers producing a slightly higher quantity of quality nectar
38 . We harvested nectar from pre-caged staminate (N = 14; 2 per site) and pistillate flowers (N = 14; 2 per site) soon after anthesis using Drummond micro-capillary tubes (10 μL) and estimated the sugar concentration using a hand-held refractometer.
